snippet: A new five-year defense plan, described as “proactive pacifism,” calls for acquiring drones and amphibious assault vehicles, and reverses a decade of military spending cuts.
lead_paragraph: A new five-year defense plan, described as “proactive pacifism,” calls for acquiring drones and amphibious assault vehicles, and reverses a decade of military spending cuts.
abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe approves five-year defense plan calling for acquisition of drones and amphibious assault vehicles to strengthen nation's military as it faces prolonged rivalry with China over islands in East China Sea; plan, described by Abe as 'proactive pacifism,' represents step away from Japan's postwar nonaggression.

headline.main: Amid Chinese Rivalry, Japan Seeks More Muscle
headline.print_headline: Amid Chinese Rivalry, Japan Seeks More Muscle
